info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 29 at 11:39AM CDT until August 2 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Des Moines IA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Des Moines IA has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Iowa...
Cedar River at Cedar Falls affecting Black Hawk county.
* WHAT...Flooding is possible.
* WHERE...The Cedar River at Cedar Falls, or from the West Fork Cedar River to the Cedar Falls-Waterloo city limits.
* WHEN...From late Wednesday night to late Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 88.5 feet, Water affects the bike path at George Wyth Park. At 88.8 feet, Water affects the north and south legs of Cottage Row Rd south of Snag Creek. At 90.0 feet, Water affects the north half of Tourist Park.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 87.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 89.0 feet.
info.instruction:
If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding.
For the latest waterway observations and forecasts refer to weather.gov/desmoines/water.
River forecasts include observed precipitation plus forecast precipitation over the next 24 hours.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING
